com.sadakatsu.clue.testserver

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sadakatsu.clue.testserver.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The Player represents an AI's server-side state and facilitates the server's communication with the AI.
    Author:
    Joseph A. Craig

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String identifier, java.net.Socket socket, java.lang.Process process)
      Instantiates a new Player for an AI that has connected to the server.

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String identifier,
      java.net.Socket socket,
      java.lang.Process process)
       throws java.io.IOException,
              ProtocolViolation
        Instantiates a new Player for an AI that has connected to the server.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier the server assigned to the AI.
        socket - The Socket through which to communicate with the AI.
        process - The process that was used to launch the AI.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ProtocolViolation

    • Method Detail

      • canDisprove

        public boolean canDisprove(Suggestion suggestion)
        Determines whether this Player can disprove the passed Suggestion.
        Parameters:
        suggestion - The Suggestion in question.
        Returns:
        true if the Player can disprove the passed Suggestion, false otherwise.

      • has

        public boolean has(Card card)
        Determines whether the Player has the passed Card in his hand.
        Parameters:
        card - The Card in question.
        Returns:
        true if the Player has the passed Card in his hand, false otherwise.

      • isEliminated

        public boolean isEliminated()
        Whether this Player has made an incorrect accusation and thus lost the game.
        Returns:
        true if the Player has already lost, false otherwise

      • disprove

        public Card disprove(int suggesterIndex,
            Suggestion suggestion)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     ProtocolViolation,
                     InvalidDisprove
        Has the Player disprove the passed Suggestion. If this Player can use more than one Card to disprove the Suggestion, the connected AI is asked which one to use.
        Parameters:
        suggesterIndex - The index of the Player that made the Suggestion.
        suggestion - The Suggestion in question.
        Returns:
        The Card the Player is using to disprove the suggestion.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ProtocolViolation
        InvalidDisprove

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        The Player's position in the play order.
        Returns:
        A number in the range [0..numberOfPlayers) if the Player is in a game. If the Player is not in a game, this was the Player's index in the last game he played (or -1 if he has not yet played a game).

      • getIndentifier

        public java.lang.String getIndentifier()
        The String used by the server to uniquely identify this Player.
        Returns:
        The String passed to the constructor.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a user-friendly String for identifying this Player.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • accusation

        public void accusation(int playerIndex,
              Suggestion accusation,
              boolean correct)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       ProtocolViolation
        Handles sending the specified accusation message to the connected AI and the AI's response.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The index of the Player that made the accusation.
        accusation - The accusation that that Player made.
        correct - Whether the accusation was correct.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ProtocolViolation

      • accuse

        public Suggestion accuse()
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         ProtocolViolation
        Asks the connected AI whether it wants to make an accusation.
        Returns:
        Returns a Suggestion representing the AI's chosen accusation, or null if the AI chose not to make an accusation.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ProtocolViolation

                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          ProtocolViolation,
                          DuplicateSuggestion
        Asks the connected AI to make a Suggestion.
        Returns:
        The Suggestion the AI chose to make.

      • reset

        public void reset(int playerCount,
         int playerIndex,
         java.util.Collection<Card> hand)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  ProtocolViolation
        Handles starting this Player in a new game.
        Parameters:
        playerCount - The number of Players in this game.
        playerIndex - This Player's position in the play order.
        hand - The Cards in this Player's hand.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ProtocolViolation

      • suggestion

        public void suggestion(int playerIndex,
              Suggestion suggestion,
              java.lang.Integer disproverIndex,
              Card card)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       ProtocolViolation
        Handles sending an update regarding the last Suggestion made to the connected AI.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The index of the Player that made the Suggestion.
        suggestion - The Suggestion in question.
        disproverIndex - The index of the Player that disproved the Suggestion.
        card - The Card that was shown to the suggesting Player. This should be null if this Player is neither the suggester nor the disprover.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ProtocolViolation
